alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued June 10 at 12:37PM PDT until June 12 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM PDT SUNDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO 5 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the second Wind Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County and Western Imperial County. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 8 AM PDT Sunday. For the second Wind Advisory, from 4 PM Sunday to 5 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West
